metadata.title: CVE-2019-11023 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The agroot() function in cgraph\obj.c in libcgraph.a in Graphviz2.39.20160612.1140 has a NULL pointer dereference, as demonstrated bygraphml2gv.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphviz - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libcdt5 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libcgraph6 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgv-guile - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgv-lua - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgv-perl - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgv-php5 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgv-python - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgv-ruby - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgv-tcl - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgvc6 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgvc6-plugins-gtk - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libgvpr2 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libpathplan4 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
libxdot4 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphviz package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.36.0-0ubuntu3.2+esm1').
